About Vantage Data Centers

Vantage Data Centers powers, cools, protects and connects the technology of the world’s well-known hyperscalers, cloud providers and large enterprises. Developing and operating across six markets in North America and five markets in Europe, Vantage has evolved data center design in innovative ways to deliver dramatic gains in reliability, efficiency and sustainability in flexible environments that can scale as quickly as the market demands.

Site Operations Department

The Site Operations Department is responsible for the overall health of all mechanical and electrical systems, building maintenance, and performance of all data modules in our data centers. The team is staffed 24 x 7 onsite with Critical Facility Engineers (CFEs) on each shift. This team is the face of Vantage to our customers and the first line of defense regarding the uptime of our campus as well as the performance of our customer installations. Using a Critical Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to plan and track work needed, the Site Operations department performs all preventative and corrective maintenance. Our culture expects and rewards team performance that engages directly with the customers and the facility infrastructure. This is a team that does most of the actual work versus calling upon vendors. As a result, we provide superior service that is faster and more cost effective.

Position Overview

The Manager, Chief Engineer will manage a team of CFEs with direction from the Director of Operations. This position will oversee workflow/work order management, training plans, event management, customer communications, hiring and performance management of their assigned CFE team. Our CFEs are respected, well-trained, customer-focused and some of the best facilities engineers you will find in the industry. This position will leverage your extensive experience to help guide the team in some of the more challenging aspects of maintenance in areas such as: critical MOP development, testing plans, sparing approaches, capital planning, end-of-life replacement and expansion of existing facilities while eliminating risk to our customers and their businesses.

While this position is leadership-focused, the intent is to be a Chief Engineer first and a people manager second. And while this role is not a ‘regular’ Critical Facilities Engineer position, if you are not someone who could pick up the tools and do the job yourself, if needed, then this position is probably not for you. Our intent is to elevate our team with a Chief Engineer who has ‘been there, done that’ and can show others how it should be done as well.

Essential Job Functions
Daily management and administration of the engineering & operations functions at the facility with the objectives of safely and effectively operating machinery and building systems
Hold employees accountable on preventive/corrective maintenance of facility equipment
Encourage and foster a team-oriented environment through positive feedback
Manage contracted service work at the facility, including understanding and developing the scope of service, bidding, awarding and administering any contracts
Duties
Train CFEs, as appropriate, in new processes and procedures
Direct and maintain the site-specific preventive maintenance and work order program
Understand the engineering and operational aspects of the building systems and recognize system performance deficiencies immediately and respond to operational and emergency situations
Using your knowledge of the systems in place, coupled with performance data collected, evaluate the performance of systems and suggest cost-effective improvements to service and operating efficiency
Ensure the availability of an adequate inventory of tools and other supplies to operate the building
Protect and improve the value of our assets and ensure that building machinery and systems meet or exceed their expected life
Organize administrative functions related to site operations, such as a work orders and maintenance activities, budgets, etc.
Assist with the preparation of operational and capital portions of the budget
Ensure that major projects performed at the building are properly planned, executed and closed out in accordance with best current practices in our industry
Oversee the activities of contractors working within the building
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business or related field, or equivalent work experience required
5+ years of experience in facility/plant engineering and maintenance supervision, strongly preferred
5+ years of direct managerial experience and interpersonal skills, strongly preferred
Universal CFC certification required, or obtained within first year of employment
Proven record of excellent internal and external customer service
Ability to communicate well in both oral and written reports
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Outlook, Word, Excel and building automation systems
Vantage Data Centers is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Description:

“Our Philosophy is simple, we believe in quality, service, performance, and integrity!”

The professionals of Hammersmith® have been dedicated to the advancement of quality living communities in Colorado for over 39 years. We pride ourselves on working with Homeowner Association's Boards and homeowners in order to provide personalized and hands-on management benefits.

We are looking for a hardworking Community Care Representative to help us in achieving this mission!

Job Title: Community Care Representative

Reports To: Community Care Manager

Hourly Rate: $15.00

Summary: The position of Community Care Representative is responsible for answering telephones, processing Work Orders, Violations Letters, and Architectural with the highest level of professionalism and accuracy always. This position offers strong support to Community Association Managers allowing them the necessary time to better focus on the long-term community goals and projects.

Location: Hammersmith® Colorado Springs Office

Schedule (please specify shift): Saturday through Wednesday 11am-8pm

Tuesday through Saturday 9am-6pm

Monday through Friday 8am-5pm

Monday through Friday 1pm-10pm

Start date: Monday, July 6, 2020

Points of Distinction:

• Great comprehensive training program!

• Career growth opportunities

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

• Process all tasks as assigned to include Work Orders, Violation Letters, Architectural, and other required tasks.

• Provide resolutions and problem-solving to ensure a satisfactory outcome for the Homeowner, Association, and Hammersmith®.

• Follow up with appropriate individuals to ensure satisfaction with completed tasks.

• Return phone calls and/or respond to messages the same day or within 24 hours of receipt.

• Assist with answering phone calls.

. Requirements:

Key Qualifications:

• Must possess personal values that are in alignment with those of the company: Excellence, Partnership, Professionalism, Integrity, and Life Balance.

• Skill in delivering excellent customer service

• Skill in attention to detail, decision-making, and problem-solving

• Ability to be professional in appearance and presentation

• Ability to prioritize and handle multiple assignments

• Ability to utilize different computer software programs

• Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing

• Ability to work in a fast paced environment

• Ability to perform duties with limited supervision

• Ability to diffuse issues with unhappy clients

Education and Experience:

• High school diploma or equivalent required

• Previous customer service experience required

Benefits:

Full time Hammersmith® employees are offered a full range of benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability Insurance, HSA and FSA participation, comprehensive 401(k) plan, sick and vacation time, volunteer day of service, and much more!

Hammersmith® is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

An Inside Sales Account Representative will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. You must be comfortable making dozens of calls per day, working with channel partners, generating interest, qualifying prospects and closing sales.

The Inside Sales Account Representative is responsible for ensuring that the high standards of customer service set forth by the Company are met. The Inside Sales Representative is responsible for growing revenue from organic revenue streams by selling all disciplines (telecommunications, transport, datacenter, cloud compute, systems integration, and wireless/VSAT) and all product lines by developing and managing sales pipeline, leading opportunity meetings with clients and closing business as quickly as possible. Additionally, the Inside Sales Representative (ISR) is responsible for renewing third party Support and Licensing contracts in pre-determined accounts as well as growth thereof. The ISR works closely with third parties and the customer to ensure that renewals are completed in a timely manner. The ISR also works closely with the GDS Sales Consultant team to ensure quick execution of transactional sales on a day-to-day basis.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The essential functions include, but are not limited to the following:
Ensure high standards of customer service are met and manage small accounts/transactions
Understanding customer needs and requirements
Finding new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails
Maintain organic revenue growth and obtain agreement/license/support renewals
Manage proposal process from start to finish in order to close the sale.
Generate qualified opportunities from inbound marketing leads and set and attend customer meetings to review potential opportunities to recommend additional services that compliment or increase existing services.
Responsible for producing accurate and aesthetically pleasing client facing proposals
Utilize engineering resources and experience to design and implement solutions that solve customer business challenges with existing products and services
Develops and maintains strong customer business relationships throughout the entire buy cycle.
Quote prices and credit terms and prepare sales contracts for orders obtained
Work with GDS Sales Consultant's to manage accounts for customer satisfaction and additional business opportunities
Responsible for entering new customer data and other sales data into the Customer Relations Management (CRM) database as required
Build and maintain vendor partnerships for lead generation, trainings, solution development and market insight
Prepares and delivers weekly sales reports as directed by manager
Maintain industry and GDS product/service knowledge by individual research, attending training, etc
Attends trade shows and other customer related events as necessary which may require weekends, overnight and after hours trips
Performs other duties as assigned.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):
Associates' degree or equivalent from two-year college or technical school in business, marketing or a related field is preferred; and two years of solution selling to accounts, preferably in Cisco or other notable channel partners in the technology or telecommunications sectors; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Additional experience selling into Healthcare, Energy, Financial, Legal, Education and Parish/State Government; prior sales and /or technical certifications are highly desirable.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees or organizations.
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, margins, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
Demonstrated ability to use MS Excel, Word and Outlook. Experience using a Customer Relationship Management system such as ConnectWise to input customer contacts, orders, sales activities, revenue forecast and related information.
Professional demeanor/presentation and phone skills. Excellent customer relationship skills.
Individuals must have a current and clear driver's license and a vehicle with appropriate insurance coverage. A Motor vehicle report may be run at least annually.

Overview

Revolutionizing business through data science and analytics, Alteryx offers an end-to-end analytics platform which empowers data analysts and scientists alike to break data barriers, deliver insights, and experience the thrill of getting to the answer faster. Organizations all over the world rely on Alteryx daily to deliver actionable insights.

Alteryx, Inc. is looking for a results-oriented Field Marketing Manager with proven expertise setting strategy, building strategic partnerships and executing targeted omni-channel marketing programs. This person will be a critical member of demand generation team and will specifically support the North America (NORAM) sales teams.

As a member of the Demand Gen team you will be responsible for developing a deep understanding of Alteryx’s personas and execute highly effective marketing campaigns that achieve pipeline and revenue goals within new and existing accounts. Position Title: Warehouse Specialist
About Data Alchemy:
Data Alchemy is a leading provider of eCommerce automation software designed to simplify and automate the management of your Amazon store front. Designed for manufacturers and suppliers wanting to better manage and maximize the value of their Amazon sales channel, our cloud-based suite features real-time repricing software, product research, automated listing service, as well as a full suite of Purchasing/MRO, Warehouse, and Supplier Management tools. As a highly-scalable turnkey provider, Data Alchemy is the second largest seller on Amazon, next to Amazon itself. We handle millions of buy boxes, 10s of millions of SKUs, and tens of thousands of price updates per minute.
This is a growing company in an industry rife with opportunities for innovation. We invite qualified, top-notch candidates to join us on this extremely lucrative and personally rewarding journey.
Position Overview:
We’re not just about packing and shipping boxes. Take your skills to the next level by joining us as we grow our warehouse operations in Oakland. You’ll learn the latest techniques in inventory management, electronic commerce, fulfillment and delivery. Serving customers world-wide, you’ll work in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team performing purchasing, order validation, receiving, inventory management, customer support, and listing development to scale our operations and provide the best service to our growing list of customers.
As we are passionate about embracing new technologies, such as machine-learning, artificial intelligence, and 3D printing, you will be working alongside our team of engineers and will use their innovative products to drive automation and efficiency through technical innovation as we grow our warehouse operations.
As a Warehouse Specialist, you will
Come up to speed quickly on Data Alchemy’s product suite, technologies used, and the functionality we offer
Have responsibility for receiving and storing inventory within the warehouse
Verify inventory quantity; monitor and assist in inventory level maintenance & restocking
Fulfill orders from our customers
Package items for shipment and coordinate delivery pickups
Work closely with vendors to verify and purchase inventory for sale
Assist with loading and unloading of inventory and products
Support the customer service team by confirming shipments, verifying products and speaking with customers
Photograph inventory items during the receiving process and at other times as required
Create an efficient system and keep a clean and well organized warehouse
Work independently or as part of a team when necessary, but always productively
Act as a leader within the company, take ownership
Required experience and knowledge – MUST HAVES
2 years’ experience performing warehouse duties or utilizing a warehouse management system
A high school diploma or equivalent is required. Some college preferred
Must be honest, energetic, hard-working, and be an excellent communicator, both verbally and written
Must be willing and able to perform many different types of tasks
Must be able to lift 50 lbs.
Strong computer skills and ability to learn new ones
Must be detail oriented, extremely organized
Willing to write things down and learn new systems
Strong analytical, debugging and problem-solving skills
Participate in a safe work environment
Demonstrate high quality work performance
Help each other by maintaining good attendance
Desired Qualifications
Experience selling in online marketplaces
Pay and Benefits
Annual salary range dependent upon experience: $37,850 - $41,850
Medical and dental benefits
Long-term disability and life insurance
Paid time off
10 paid holidays per year
Snacks and soft drinks provided during breaks
Flexible working hours
Free parking on site

Data Systems Analysts, Inc. is searching for a customer focused Cybersecurity Lead to join our team in Huntsville, AL, to provide support to the Army and to begin an exciting career within DSA.
The Cybersecurity Lead will be responsible for responsibilities including overseeing automation, data/telecommunications, visual information and records management for the Program Executive Office (PEO) Missile and Space (MS). PEO MS provides centralized management for Army Air and Missile Defense and Tactical Missile Programs as well as selected Army Space programs that leverage state-of-art technology to meet Warfighter multi-domain and full spectrum operation requirements.

The Cybersecurity Lead will provide Cybersecurity for all PEO MS systems including the underlying infrastructures that are vulnerable to a wide range of risk from both physical and cyber threats and hazards.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Conducting assessments of threats and vulnerabilities
Determine deviations from acceptable configurations, enterprise or local policy
Assess the levels of risk and developing and/or recommending appropriate mitigation countermeasures
Conducting the integration/testing, operations, and maintenance of systems security.
Providing planning, implementation, monitoring, and continuously improving processes to support the Army's operations
Coordinating and monitoring mission activities in the areas of systems and systems integration support
Providing innovative approaches to strategic technical planning and solutions to overcome operational challenges and obstacles.
Lead complex tasks, including review of work products for correctness, compliance with industry
best practices, DoD standards, and Army standards.

Experience working within the Risk Management Framework (RMF).
In-depth experience with general IT security concepts, network security and software development practices/methodologies.
Demonstrated experience in providing Cloud-based security solutions

Excellent knowledge of application development methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Dev Ops)

Experience leading technical discussions with internal and external customers.

Experience with general IT security concepts, network security and software development practices/methodologies.
Experience with FISMA and NIST, security standards

Data Systems Analysts, Inc. is searching for aa customer focused Network Lead to join our team in Huntsville, AL, to provide support to the Army and to begin an exciting career within DSA.

The Network Lead will be responsible for responsibilities including overseeing automation, data/telecommunications, visual information and records management for the Program Executive Office (PEO) Missile and Space (MS). PEO MS provides centralized management for Army Air and Missile Defense and Tactical Missile Programs as well as selected Army Space programs that leverage state-of-art technology to meet Warfighter multi-domain and full spectrum operation requirements.

The Network Lead will provide voice, data and video technical support for all the PEO networks and systems to include the PEO Enterprise Network, PEO Classified network, PEO Classified Standalone systems and all relevant applications, interfaces and devices in approximately 18 individual facilities.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Provide technical support for interconnectivity issues between other interconnected Local Area Networks (LANs)/Wide Area Networks (WANs) and communications networks, both Unclassified and Classified
Providing innovative approaches to strategic technical planning and solutions to overcome operational challenges and obstacles.
Provide network monitoring, testing, management and administration services required to maintain and re-engineer all existing and future PEO networks.
Lead complex tasks, including review of work products for correctness, compliance with industry
best practices, DoD standards, and Army standards.

Position Requirements
Bachelor's degree (required) Master's degree (desired) in Engineering or Networks.
CISCO Network Professional Security (CCNP) or equivalent certification is mandatory.
8 to 10 years of experience in design and computer network architecture and data communication networks, such as local area networks (LAN), wide area networks (WAN), intranets, extranets, and other data communications networks experience.
Experience implementing industry best practices and standards for mission network support, including ITIL, LSS, AQA, Malcolm Baldridge and CMMI compliant processes.
Provide expertise in network infrastructure, architecture management, design, and performance tuning.
Must have minimum 5 years of experience performing technical oversight and analysis of contractor approaches, designs, best practices
Experience working within the Risk Management Framework (RMF).
Perform network modeling, analysis, and planning of networks
Research and recommend network and data communications hardware and software.
Experience with requirements analysis, project planning, resource management, risk management, strategic planning, quality assurance, enterprise-level systems deployment, software security architectures and federal Government security policies.
Technical expertise in current and emerging cloud technologies.
Possess knowledge and experience with Department of Defense (DOD)/Army plans, policies, standards, and methods aimed at the acquisition and support of military programs and resources for Army systems
Experience leading technical discussions with internal and external customers.

Preferred
Experience working in large, complex IT environments
Experience with general IT security concepts, network security and software development practices/methodologies.
Prior Military network experience and familiarity with Army Data Policy.

Overview
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the leading cloud provider, providing virtualized infrastructure, storage, networking, messaging, and many other services to customers all over the world. AWS runs a globally distributed environment, operating at massive levels AWS’s multi-tenant infrastructure. Governmental organizations are also looking to and depending on AWS for cloud solutions and services.

AWS is looking for a Classified Material Custodian to support the AWS Infrastructure Operations (Infra-Ops) team in maintaining a sound security posture for US Intelligence Community (USIC) Cloud technologies and activities. As a member of the Infra-Ops team, the candidate will be responsible for receipt, issue, safeguarding, accounting, and when necessary the destruction of classified material in accordance with US Government security standards.

The ideal candidate will bring physical security, project management, process creation and improvement, and auditing skills to this position. In addition, the candidate will assist in the development and implementation of related security procedures and training for handling classified material. Critical thinking, process improvement, and independent problem solving will be key in this role.

Exceptional communication skills are paramount. The successful candidate will be a strong communicator both written and verbally, and will lead multi-discipline, process improvement project initiatives. The candidate should possess the ability to work independently to continuously improve material handling and preemptively identify and mitigate risks. The right candidate for this role will also have basic familiarity with computer hardware.

Among Other Duties, the Information Security Material Custodian Will:

• Manage the Infra-Ops classified material program to ensure procedures are developed and operated in accordance with internal and customer security policies and practices.
• Develop, track, and report on key program performance metrics.
• Continuously monitor processes and drive improvements in efficiency and quality of our security programs.
• Develop, communicate, and maintain project roadmaps.
• Provide training and awareness to employees for materials handling, reporting requirements, accountability, and destruction procedures.
• Map current processes and procedures to establish baselines and recommend areas for process improvements.
• Effectively prioritize and execute tasks.
• Be self-motivated, able to work with minimal day-to-day guidance and have the ability to own problems through to resolution
• Responsible for the maintenance of up-to-date records and the submission of all required accounting reports.

· 3+ years of working knowledge of regulations, directives, processes and procedures for the control of highly classified materials
• Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and projects in a dynamic environment that changes daily
• Working knowledge in program and project management, planning, and development tools. PMP certification is a plus
• Experience in creation of detailed process maps and success implementing a continuous improvement program
• Detailed understanding of data communication and telecommunication technology.
• Strong understanding of U.S. federal IT security mandates, security standards and compliance for national security mission systems operating in a multi-tenant infrastructure/platform as a service environment.

New York Engagement Coordinator

Benefits Data Trust (BDT) seeks an Engagement Coordinator to support the launch of a new benefits access initiative in New York City. The Engagement Coordinator will provide support to a network of more than 50 Community Based Organizations (CBOs) as they utilize BDT’s new benefits access software (“Benefits Launch”) for eligibility screenings and enrollment assistance. The Coordinator helps prepare, develop, and support the initial roll-out and ongoing success in accordance with project timeframe and goals. The Coordinator organizes and conducts presentations and training for community partners and facilitates regular meetings and information exchanges to ensure all customers and partners remain aware of relevant information.

The NY Engagement Coordinator reports to the NY Engagement Manager, based in New York City.

Main Responsibilities:
Support the NY Engagement Manager in building buy-in from CBOs for a tech-enabled benefits access collaborative and identify areas for continued improvement and collaboration
Coordinate and provide initial and ongoing training in collaboration with BDT’s HQ Training team
Provide technical assistance and on-site/virtual support to the CBO network as it relates to benefits policy and Benefits Launch technology
Serve as a resource by maintaining strong procedural knowledge of public benefits, community resources, and Benefits Launch to assist CBOs with troubleshooting, as appropriate
Facilitate presentations from community partners or resources, and professional development opportunities for members of the network
Lead and facilitate meetings with CBOs, including preparation of agendas, taking minutes, and following up on all next steps in a timely fashion
Develop and maintain relationships with benefits access experts and groups to increase project awareness, build trust, identify client referral opportunities, and learn about other service or support opportunities for clients
Support peer-to-peer learning by planning and facilitating regular meetings with the CBO network
Maintain regular contact with city agencies to ensure resources and training are communicated to the network
Engage in annual organizational and departmental goal setting and conduct ongoing assessment of goal progress
Requirements:
Deep understanding of New York City and New York City public benefits
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Ability to prioritize competing priorities effectively
Comfortable with facilitating and presenting in front of large groups
Previous administration and office experience
Strong ability to translate complex content for diverse audiences
Informal or formal experience training or coaching
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite; especially Excel and PowerPoint
Professional or native/bilingual-level fluency in Spanish a plus
Due to COVID-19, BDT is operating under a remote-working protocol, following governmental requirements and CDC guidelines. While this job will begin as fully remote, when BDT determines it is safe to do so based on public health recommendations, we may move back to an office setting, and resume frequent travel throughout NYC and periodic travel to Philadelphia.

About BDT:

Benefits Data Trust is a national nonprofit that helps people live healthier, more independent lives by creating smarter ways to access essential benefits and services. Each year, BDT helps tens of thousands of people receive critical supports using data, technology, targeted outreach, and policy change. Since its inception in 2005, BDT has screened more than one million households and secured over $7.5 billion in benefits and services. BDT employs more than 250 people and provides enrollment assistance to individuals in six states, and policy assistance to states nationwide. For more information, visit bdtrust.org.

Benefits Data Trust (BDT) seeks a Pennsylvania Engagement Manager to cultivate and maintain partnerships to deliver smarter ways to access essential benefits and services so people can live healthier, more independent lives. The PA Engagement Manager will develop and manage the relationships needed to make BDT’s work successful in the Greater Philadelphia region. The Engagement Manager will continually assess opportunities to increase benefits access in the Philadelphia area in line with the organization’s strategic priorities through the development of relationships with state and local government and community-based organizations (CBOs), as well as with health plans, funders, and research institutions. BDT has a broad vision for combating poverty in Philadelphia by transforming how residents access benefits, and the PA Engagement Manager will play a critical role in developing and implementing that strategic vision.

The PA Engagement Manager's primary responsibility will be to deepen and expand BenePhilly, a robust benefits access network funded in partnership with the City of Philadelphia's Office of Community Empowerment and Opportunity that helps Philadelphians apply for federal, state and local benefit programs. This person will be responsible for maintaining and expanding the services and tools BDT provides throughout the region. The PA Engagement Manager will manage communications between the City and the network of partners; oversee CBO training, reporting and evaluation; and conduct presentations and meetings with various partners within the region.

Based in our Center City Philadelphia office, the PA Engagement Manager will report to the Pennsylvania Senior Engagement Manager and supervise a Pennsylvania Engagement Coordinator, responsible for the daily operations of the BenePhilly network.

Due to COVID-19, BDT is operating under a remote-working protocol, following governmental requirements and CDC guidelines. While this job will begin as fully remote, when BDT determines it is safe to do so based on public health recommendations, we will move back into our Centre Square office. At that time, all Philadelphia-based staff will be required to transition back into the office.

Responsibilities:
Develop and implement plans for the Philadelphia region based on organizational priorities and goals
Strengthen relationships with existing partners and cultivate new partnerships, focusing on City offices and key stakeholders, advocates and community-based organizations
Serve as a conduit between the BenePhilly CBOs and the City to ensure the ongoing success of the BenePhilly initiative
Oversee and create external communication with key partners and funders, provide program status reports, outline new opportunities to enhance the BenePhilly network, and share best practices across network users
Represent BDT in relevant state and local task forces, workgroups, and conferences and present about BenePhilly to increase project awareness and strengthen community relationships
Provide content for proposals, fact sheets, presentations, blogs, etc. for a range of audiences
Coordinate with BDT’s Projects team to prioritize operational resources to deliver on contractual obligations and manage partner expectations effectively
Facilitate the execution of contracts with BDT’s Finance and Projects teams
Keep relevant BDT staff informed of conversations with key stakeholders and document them using Salesforce
Supervise the Engagement Coordinator as they carry out their responsibilities by setting clear expectations and providing training, support, professional development opportunities
Support the Pennsylvania Senior Engagement Manager with existing partnerships and initiatives with government, philanthropy and more across the state of Pennsylvania as needed
Engage in annual organizational and departmental goal setting and conduct ongoing assessment of goal progress
Qualifications:
At least seven years’ experience cultivating and managing relationships with government, community-based organizations, healthcare entities or philanthropy
Superior oral communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively work with internal and external teams; able to facilitate group discussions and to present in front of large audiences
Exceptional writing skills and the ability to draft and edit a wide variety of materials, including but not limited to proposals, presentations, fact sheets, and funder reports
Ability to analyze and present complex data, including simplifying concepts for a wide array of audiences
Ability to project manage and change courses quickly to adapt to new development and deadlines
High level of proficiency in MS Office (including MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) as well as the ability to learn new program management tools
Commitment to improving the lives of underserved populations
When public health leaders determine it is safe to do so, the ability to travel throughout the region to meet with partners and community members, including some nights and weekends as needed
Experience working with underserved populations in the Philadelphia area
Experience providing direct supervision to staff or volunteers
Knowledge and familiarity of the public benefits landscape
Knowledge and familiarity with the social tech/civic tech landscape

Interview: Phone and Skype

Duration: 6 months Contract to hire

Job description

The UX Designer is accountable to support the tactical direction and holistic design work output and deliverables associated with assigned projects. The UX Designer is typically responsible for supporting multiple aspects projects within a singular track of work within a platform / suite of products. The UX Designer is an advocate for usability and interface design, and is responsible for the delivery and output of quality and timely design deliverables including wireframes, prototypes, and presentations, user interface elements. The UX Designer is ultimately responsible for managing the visual and interactive creative assets, as well as their final solution and setting the building blocks within the Lowe's Digital design system. The UX Designer should have general knowledge of external processes and technologies, both standard and unique to Lowe's including the work processes, technologies, platforms, and services of our business and IT capabilities. The UX Designer will work with a team of other Architects, Designers, Prototypers, and Content Developers to deliver projects in a timely and efficient manner, consistent with the process and standards set in place both internally and externally across the business. The UX Designer may serve as a "project lead" within small to medium-scale projects, and will be responsible for the direction and approval of other design work within that project.

Skills:
Design 6 + Years
Prototype 6 + Years
User Interface Design 6 + Years
Wireframes
B2B or B2C
Visual Design experience
User Journey Mapping
Prior work in Agile Environment
Will be designing product Configurators
Customer Management Tools
Experience mentoring other UX Designers (Nice to have)
In Store Facing Tools
Portfolio need- Examples of UX designs for B2C or B2B, Wireframes, Larger Scale projects

SMS is seeking a Defensive Cyberspace Operations (DCO) Operator to join our team on our Air Force Project. This position will work closely with providing support to report findings; perform monitoring operations; report cyber security events and anomalies; provide analysis and recommendations, Vulnerability Management (VM) and Malware Protection (MP) / Vulnerability Assessment and Analysis (VAA), Intrusion Analysis and Correlation Information, incident handling, Mission Operations Transfer (MOX), exercise and assessment support.

SMS has been serving the advanced information technology needs of the federal government since 1976, delivering talented teams and innovative, cost-effective solutions and services to support our customers’ missions for more than 40 years. SMS is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with offices and on-site operations at customer locations throughout the United States. As a dynamic systems integrator, SMS offers proven solutions in engineering, operations, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. With expertise in modernizing and optimizing legacy infrastructure and systems, ensuring operational efficiency, and designing, implementing, and managing secure environments, SMS supports business and mission goals with proficiency, quality, and integrity. Join our team of top talent in supporting the federal government.

DCO Operator Lead is responsible for the overall operation of the DCO team, monitors team effectiveness, and is the liaison between DCO Operators and Gov’t Leadership. Further, DCO Operator Lead ensures mission system owners/operators and the appropriate leadership are aware of any ongoing cyber events and incidents through recurring incident awareness briefs.

DCO Operator completes tasks designed to ensure security of the organization's systems and information assets.
Provide recommendation and implement strategies for the optimal Protect, Detect, and Respond actions
Protects against unauthorized access, modification, or destruction.
Assess mission critical services and recommend Information Condition (INFOCON) level changes, Cyber Protection Condition (CPCON) level changes, and resiliency methods.
Effectively identify and communicate cyber incidents and anomalies and to effectively communicate, oral and written, mission impacts and recommendations for corrective actions and planning efforts.
Implement policies or procedures and tracks compliance throughout the organization.
Must be knowledgeable of NIST, DoD, and vendor publications.
Must be familiar with vulnerability, STIG, and Network scanners (ACAS, SCC, NMAP, etc.).
Familiar with SIEM tools and reports (ArcSight, Splunk, SolarWinds).
Clearance
Must have a current DoD TS/SCI SAP Clearance
Certifications
Must have a current Security+ certificate and an IT industry certification that satisfies DoD 8570 requirements
Education
Bachelor’s degree in a related field preferred
Experience
3-5 years of experience in a Cyber security field.

The Sales Enablement Program Manager is responsible for all revenue roles (AE, SE, SDR, Sales Leadership, CSM). They will ensure that every Go-To-Market teammate has the required knowledge, skills, processes, and behaviors to optimize every interaction with buyers and customers. The Sales Enablement Manager will partner with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to improve critical processes and develop a strategy for sales, sales development, and customer success teams training and content. This role will be responsible for coordinating enablement and creating content. Reporting to the Head of Revenue Operations, this role will partner with the broader Go-to-Market leadership teams.
What you'll accomplish
Partner with the sales team to identify gaps in performance and develop recommendations and programs to improve, serving as lead for 1:1, manager-led, and targeted learning programs
Drive the success of major enablement initiatives, including bi-annual kick off, bootcamps, weekly sales training, and certifications
Own the discovery, development, implementation, and analysis of interactive and engaging sales training content in multiple formats (instructor led, eLearning, virtual learning, knowledge transfer)
Build out on-boarding program to make Sisu go-to-market team world-class; help to ramp Account Executives, SDRs and CSMs to effectively to hit their targets
Create programs for ongoing enablement and learning for sales: sales pitch certification, sales process/playbook creation, sales personas, use cases, competitive messaging, product launches, etc. – partnering heavily with Product Marketing
Identify content gaps and organize content with a content map for the company. Help AEs, SDRs and CSM save time by not searching for content across multiple sources
Build support tools and training content design - battle cards, standard operating procedures, best practices, pro-tips
Act as a sales enablement and product subject matter expert by staying up-to-date on current processes, products, and platforms, as well as sales industry trends
Use data to measure the impact of Enablement programs
Work directly with product teams, subject matter experts, sales leadership, and marketing to support go-to-market enablement needs
Help our sales teams get the most out of our current sales tech stack and guide future evaluations of new & existing sales technology
Identify content gaps and organize content with a content map for the company. Help Account Executives save time by not searching for content across multiple sources
What you'll need to be successful
3-5 years supporting a direct B2B sales organization in an enablement/training function. Prior experience operating in a quota carrying role is a plus
Excellent communications skills (both written and verbal) and comfort with public speaking
Extensive knowledge of sales training best practices (analysis, instructional design, delivery, implementation, and evaluation)
Extensive knowledge of modern sales methodologies, sales process, and buyer’s journey alignment. Experience with Command the Message, Sandler, Proactive Selling, etc. is a plus
Strong project management and stakeholder alignment capabilities
Comfort learning and managing business technologies
Demonstrated ability to manage priorities and deliver enablement activities that drive results
Proficiency in building lasting relationships with senior level sales leaders
Highly organized and analytical in nature with outstanding project management skills
Ability to collaborate with many different teams and personalities
For a sales enablement leader, there’s no better environment to advance your career, develop your skills, and make an impact along the way. As you build this team at Sisu, you’ll have the chance to work with global leaders, learn from industry experts, and help build an amazing, eclectic, and supportive organization.

Job Title: Director of Purchasing (Remote Location Required: CA, AZ, OR, WA)
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY: BASIC FUNCTION

The Director of Purchasing is responsible for managing the daily activities of the purchasing department, oversight of the construction department’s Owner Furnished Contractor Installed (OFCI) procurement and General Contractor agreements. Responsibilities include employee development, vendor pricing, contract negotiation, develop and maintain vendor management program, develop, and track department KPIs to meet company objectives as well as maximize financial performance. The Director of Purchasing is an essential part of our business. They must work with additional departments to ensure their procurement needs are met, while maximizing vendor relationships and financial performance of the company.

ESENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Establish, maintain, and report on measurable performance metrics for all levels of procurement activities. This includes but is not limited to supplier performance, supplier quality, internal order placement performance, buyer activity levels, and purchasing cost savings.
Negotiate long term national contracts to support multi-site procurement.
Strategically develop and implement commodity/supply chain strategies that cover all commodities, services, and supplier processes throughout the organization to deliver maximum value, leverage, and standardization.
Establish and manage Operational Inventory Program to ensure operations has the proper equipment & material to support customer SLAs.
Establish and maintain Vendor Management Program, including a Vendor screening process and Vendor performance review.
negotiate commercial terms for vendor MSAs.
Manage and develop purchasing staff to support department initiatives and processes.
Establish and maintain purchasing best practices and procedures, including but not limited to RFP process, bid leveling, ethics, etc.
Oversight of Construction General Contractor and OFCI Equipment purchases made by the construction department.
Oversight of Vendor Managed Inventory Program.
Ensure that purchasing controls are established, enforced, and maintained.
Track, report, and drive cost saving efforts to maximize financial performance of the company.
Develop and maintain vendor relationships.
Address issues such as (e.g. change orders, late deliveries, disputes, invoice accuracy, etc) with suppliers. Investigates, responds, and brings closure to suppliers, Buyer’s Agent, or other internal NTT GDC Americas, Inc. stakeholders.
Work with construction to renegotiate, extend options, renew, and discontinue supplier framework agreements. Make sure required and issue equipment orders are under those framework agreements.
Analyze industrial trends and evolving technology to proactively identify supply base issues to minimize risk, protect continuity of supply, and capture industry best practice.
Performs other duties as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Sourcing and Procurement processes.
Oracle procurement and Purchasing Manager modules.
Basic knowledge of Construction Materials & Data Centers.
Basic knowledge of IT systems and infrastructure.
Working knowledge of MS Windows / Office programs including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Excellent verbal, written communication skills and organizational skills.
Is strong in math and deductive reasoning skills.
Fact-to-fact conversation skills.
Team building that promotes inclusiveness and communication among team members.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize task, as well as work independently.
Ability to take/give direction.
Ability to work within and meet deadline constraints.
Able to be highly confidential.
Manages stress and/or fast pace effectively.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Must demonstrate a working knowledge in best practice procurement processes, negotiating purchase order terms, conditions, pricing, cost reductions, supplier qualification processes, vendor selection, account development, logistics, and sourcing.
Must have overall knowledge of Data Centers.
Ability to work in a team environment.
Ability to remain even-tempered and able to work through conflict with others.
Manages stress and/or fast pace effectively.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Able to be highly confidential.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Business Administration, or relevant field.
Minimum of seven years of procurement required; five years in a management role; five years in mission critical/data center preferred.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Familiarity with construction sites, factory hazards and ability to navigate project sites safely and in control.
Primarily walking, standing, and bending with some sitting.
Able to hear and speak into a telephone.
Close visual work on a computer terminal.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments.
Able to lift and carry up to 25 lbs.
WORK CONDITION
Must be comfortable working in a highly critical, fast paced environment with shifting priorities.
Must be available by phone during assigned work schedule, as well as after hours for emergency situations.
Must be willing to work outside normal business hours, including weekends, late nights, holidays, and on-call support.
SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
Periodic (est. 10%) national travel to NTT jobsites, vendor facilities, and industry events.
This role is expected to be remote with an occasional need to be on-site in a shared space.
Must maintain a current, valid state-issued driver’s license.

The Operations Leadership Development Program (OLDP) is designed to prepare high potential candidates to take on roles at QTS leading teams, functions, and/or P&Ls. The OLDP is an 18 to 24 month program during which participating Project Managers (PMs) will go through four rotations (three to six months each) in the different Operations functions (1. Site Operations, 2. Property Development/Engineering, 3. Strategy/Finance/Analytics, and 4. PM elective). Elective rotations may also be outside of Operations (Sales, Product Management, Customer Care, etc.). In each rotation, PMs will lead a function-specific process improvement project while developing a solid understanding of that function’s responsibilities and challenges.

Upon completion of the ODLP, QTS leadership will work with the participant to identify a leadership role in the company that matches their interests and skill set. Placement opportunities will not be limited to the Operations organization.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES, other duties may be assigned.
Lead process improvement and business process reengineering efforts in critical areas directly impacting site operations, property development, property engineering, real estate acquisition, sustainability, and strategy/analytics.
Develop solid understanding of the data center industry, QTS product offering, and QTS operating model.
Form and manage cross-functional project teams to achieve objectives.
Analyze the operational and financial impacts of proposed solutions to make impactful recommendations.
Regularly present findings to Operations and QTS leadership.


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field, Finance, or Economics.
Four or more years of professional experience.
Superior people skills – must be able to work effectively with multiple business groups including sales, engineering, legal and finance, and with all levels of the organization from senior executives to support staff.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced degree (technical Master’s degree or MBA)
Seven or more years of professional experience.
Two or more years in a supervisory role.
Experience in technology, construction, engineering, or energy sectors.
Solid proficiency in MS Office applications, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
Process Improvement Certifications (Lean, Six Sigma, etc.).
Management consulting experience.
Geographic flexibility within two years.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
High attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong initiative and creativity.
An enthusiastic attitude in a team environment and ability to work independently.
Comfort teaming with all levels of an organization, including presenting to senior executives.

At Sisu, we're building a software platform that empowers people to make better decisions using data. Based on years of cutting-edge research at Stanford, Sisu enables users to quickly and comprehensively understand what’s driving their key metrics, so they never miss a window of opportunity to act.

Sisu leverages the massive amounts of data available within private, first-party data warehouses, which capture a real-time, structured view of organizational behavior. By monitoring the performance of key metrics like revenue, retention, and churn, and their relationships to interactions between key factors like user demographics, campaigns, and acquisition channels, we can help users make better decisions. The key problem Sisu solves is to help identify what’s driving change among this enormous feature and hypothesis space. To do so, we combine statistical analysis and machine learning at scale to provide users personalized, real-time diagnoses of changes in their metrics via an explainable, interpretable user interface.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of the Sisu Engine - a query processor that is optimized for hypothesis testing at a large scale with speeds of millions of records faster than any other system. You’ll have the opportunity to work on challenging technical problems combining data management, machine learning, distributed systems and develop key features that can be attributed to only a handful of engineers.
Responsibilities
Design, engineer, and operate Sisu's scalable parallel data processing engine, including distributed query processing, columnar execution, and streaming updates
Develop novel and scalable systems combining hardware-accelerated data processing with machine learning and statistical hypothesis testing
Technical leadership
Shape the engineering culture through mentorship
Build out our data plane
Implement new analyses in our performance-critical data processing engine
Optimize and scale data ingest and workload distribution
Actively participate in customer POCs to optimize customer experience and adoption.
Work collaboratively with multiple departments such as Sales, Marketing, and G&A.
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of relevant software engineering experience
Fluency with a manual memory-managed language (C++, C, etc.) OR Rust
Background in database internals or building core components for data processing systems (query compilation, query execution, storage engines, transaction processing)
Strong CS fundamentals including data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems.

Forge Institute seeks multiple Cybersecurity Instructors who will be responsible for developing curriculum based on our private and public partner needs, developing labs and projects, assessments and other components of our cyber training programs. Remote Arkansas. Open to Remote USA.

We are seeking experienced cyber instructors who want to help shape the cyber workforce of our partnering organizations. Both private and public sector companies are counting on us to train new and incumbent employees to protect their critical infrastructure against the most advanced attackers in the world. Our training and professional development team needs your experience in cybersecurity to help trainees step up their game. You'll work with some of the best cyber operators carrying the lessons of the occupation to a classroom environment. If your skill set includes a variety of expertise in cyber, including network concepts, operating systems, scripting languages and IT architecture with a red team, blue team, and even purple team frame of mind, then this position is for you! Having the ability to speak at multiple levels of cybersecurity competence is highly desired.

Am I an Instructor/Curriculum Development Candidate?
Can you effectively communicate complex cybersecurity topics to an audience with a wide variety of familiarity to raise awareness and peak interest in our upcoming programs?
Do you have a background in cybersecurity and/or security operations and enjoy explaining the components of ramping up an organization's cyber team?
Are you passionate about raising awareness in cybersecurity while providing education solutions to create a stronger cyber tech community?
Can you confidently illustrate the leading edge of information security? Could you attend a distinguished conference or workshop and then adequately convey the information acquired to your colleagues?
Can you interact effectively with entry-level cyber professionals who might need to be un-taught some old bad habits before they can learn some new TTPs?
Are you able to assess an individual's skill level and quickly adapt to a training approach that better resonates with them?
Typical Responsibilities:
Develop cyber security modules based on network concepts, techniques, tools and procedures relevant to securing an organization's infrastructure, vulnerability scanning & management, risk assessments & remediation, threat intelligence, incident response and other cybersecurity topics.
Instruct in-depth training based on topics above. This includes managing course delivery by alternate instructors and SMEs who aren't professional trainers, ensuring the trainees receive the best possible training available nationwide.
Conduct off-site cybersecurity awareness workshops for our partners and other community leaders, which includes creating the content for leave-behinds.
Create, extend, enhance or revise course material to align with trainee sponsored employers.
Assume the role as a subject matter expert to prospective partners and trainees, promoting the upcoming program, professional development and/or cyber bootcamp opportunities and the benefits to potential partners/organizations/cyber operators.
Produce high-quality written and verbal reports upon conclusion of cyber bootcamp program and any additional training opportunities that require the evaluation of skills acquired/developed.
Represent Forge Institute and it's programs through community outreach engagement. This includes attending relevant cyber and tech community groups, conferences, etc., offering to participate in relevant group discussions (panel discussions), and any additional outreach opportunities assigned to you.
Required Qualifications: Successful candidates will have experience in the following areas and have the ability to effectively educate to multiple levels of training pools
Cyber Tech: experience teaching technical topics to a wide variety of audiences, from help desk and system admins to C-level executives.
Incident Response: experience conducting or managing incident response investigations for organizations and effectively training the participants within the various training courses offered.
Reverse Engineering: ability to perform static and dynamic malware analysis and familiarity with the tools available.
Incident Remediation: strong understanding of targeted attacks and able to create customized tactical and strategic remediation plans for compromised organizations.
Network Operations and Architecture/Engineering: strong understanding of secure network architecture and experience performing network operations.
Programming/Scripting: experience in common scripting languages.
Professional client-facing demeanor, comfortable in the classroom & range/lab and the boardroom.
Strong, clear verbal and written communication skills.
Capable of completing tasks on time without supervision.
Desire to grow and expand both technical and soft skills.
Strong project management skills.
Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude. Preferred Education Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Information Security, Information Assurance, Information Security Management, Intelligence Studies, Cybersecurity, Cybersecurity Policy
Benefits of Working at Forge Institute
Ability to suggest upcoming cyber courses with opportunity to attend forward-facing cyber leader's training courses
Direct input and influence in the development of workforce in Arkansas and beyond
Flexible work environment - may work remotely during off-training days/weeks/months
Optimal vacation time

Description:

Job Title: Porter

Reports To: Community Association Manager

Wage: $15-16/hr.

Schedule: Saturday, Sunday, Monday; Hours TBD

Customary Behavior: To consciously, specifically, intentionally practice our Core Values, Mission Statement, and Our Shared Commitment daily.

Summary: Under regular supervision of the Community Manager, the Custodian performs any combination of light cleaning duties to maintain a safe and clean environment within the structure of the property.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: (Other duties may be assigned.)

• Clean hallways, lobbies and elevators

• Vacuum, sweep, scrub, wax and polish floors using brooms, mops or powered machines

• Dust and polish furniture

• Wash windows, walls, doors as necessary

• Remove debris from Spa area, organize the Spa furniture, clean grill exterior

• Empty trash containers in common areas

• Disinfect equipment and supplies using germicides

• Clean and stock restrooms

• Observe and report any maintenance needs or unusual issues in common areas, including hallways, lobby, elevators, grounds and parking garage

• Submit re-order requests to maintain adequate inventory of supplies and equipment

• Maintain a neat and organized cleaning storage area

• Complete a daily report(s) and check list(s)

• Carries designated, shared cell phone during shift

• Other duties as assigned

Performance Standards

• Excellent communicator

• Delivers and exceeds client, resident, guest expectations

• Acknowledges residents and guests

• Presents a professional demeanor and possesses a “Client-First” attitude

• Effectively assists with resident’s needs and responds to resident and guest inquiries/questions

• Performs cleaning responsibilities with attention to detail

• Submits required records, logs, and reports

. Requirements:

• Ability to prioritize and handle multiple assignments

• Self-starter; takes initiative

• Must be customer-service oriented

• Meet quality standards

• Must be able to communicate effectively with residents, staff and outside resources• Must be observant and show attention to detail

• Must be familiar with proper use of cleaning equipment and chemicals

• Must be capable of performing duties with limited supervision

• Must perform general physical activities that require use of arms and legs, heavy lifting, moving of heavy objects, balancing, stooping, handling of materials, operating cleaning machines

• Must possess personal values that are in alignment with those of the company: Excellence, Partnership, Professionalism, Integrity and Life Balance.

Education and Experience:

• High School diploma or equivalent

• At least 6 months related experience in housekeeping

Working Environment:

While performing the duties of this position, the porter may come into contact with residents and guests. This role is primarily responsible for cleaning common areas and routinely uses standard cleaning equipment.

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to frequently stand and walk.
The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
The employee may frequently lift and/or move items of medium to heavy weight.

Job Type: Full-time

Summary

The Sr. Manager Trade Compliance supports the Vice-President, Compliance involving CEFD’s trade (export/import) compliance program. This position will drive initiatives involving compliance processes/procedures, training, classification, licensing, recordkeeping, audits, investigations/disclosures, and system automation opportunities. The Sr. Manager Trade Compliance additionally will have other compliance support duties as assigned by the Vice-President, Compliance.

Responsibilities and Essential Duties
Maintains expert knowledge of current legal and regulatory requirements in the areas of U.S export/import compliance and documentation [Export Administration Regulations (EAR), International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), Office of Foreign Assets Control Regulations (OFAC), Foreign Trade Regulations (FTR), U.S. Customs regulations, and Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (BATFE)]; non-U.S. export/import requirements including Canada, China, and India; Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA); and Federal Acquisition Regulations/Defense Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR/DFAR).
Assists with the development and maintains best practices and guidelines to ensure compliance consistency and accuracy with laws and regulations including U.S. and non-U.S. requirements. Writes, implements, and updates formalized policies and procedures to ensure consistent processes and program compliance.
Conducts training and audits throughout CEFD to ensure adherence to compliance requirements.
Guides, assists, and coordinates the classification of CEFD’s products and technologies that are manufactured and purchased (i.e. export classification, HTS, country of origin).
Prepares, submits, and administers export/import licenses and permits under the Export Administration Regulations (EAR), International Traffic in Arms (ITAR), Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) Regulations, and other correspondence or authorizations as needed.
Supports restricted party screening for transactions/facility visits and briefings for international travel.
Coordinates, discusses, and implements licensing and compliance strategies with all CEFD functions/locations.
Ensures compliance with regulatory recordkeeping requirements.
Timely informs the Vice-President, Compliance of identified legal issues and risks faced by Compliance operations. Assists Vice-President, Compliance with investigations and applicable voluntary disclosures involving suspected shortfalls in compliance.
In coordination with the Vice-President, Compliance; interacts with the U.S. Departments of Commerce, State, Defense, Treasury, and Customs to advocate and resolve regulatory and transactional questions involving export/import issues.
Supports Shipping and Receiving departments in the timely export/import of EAR/ITAR controlled hardware, software and/or data as appropriate. Functions as a liaison between Shipping/Purchasing, Foreign Party, and/or U.S. Government to ensure paperwork meets all regulatory requirements.
Interacts directly with CEFD’s freight forwarders and customs brokers to resolve trade compliance issues.
Assists with the provision of direction on new venture or country opportunity as to regulatory implications.
Reviews all presentations/briefings and other information to be provided to non-US persons for compliance with licenses and regulations prior to release. Provides guidance on what data and assistance is allowed and what restrictions may apply.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or higher. Equivalent experience will be considered.
Seven (7) or more years in an EAR, ITAR and OFAC licensing and compliance environment.
Experience in defense and/or commercial contracting.
Knowledge of US export/import requirements (ITAR, EAR, OFAC, FTR, Customs), non-US export/import requirements, US contracting requirements (FAR, DFAR) and other regulations (FCPA, UK Bribery Act).
Ability to review, comprehend, and interpret complex legal documents such as export licenses and contracts/purchase orders.
Proven analytical and problem-solving ability with a positive and solution-team oriented approach.
Ability to set up/coordinate policy and procedure development to support compliance program and drive requirements to operational levels within the company.
Demonstrated ability to use appropriate judgment in interpreting regulations and applying standards for compliance to support and protect the business.
Knowledge of international transport terminology, documents, standards such as INCOTERMS 2020.
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills and the ability to lead with minimal oversight.
Ability to independently prioritize workload and shift with changing priorities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including ability to effectively discuss matters at all levels within the company.
High skills in building strong customer service relationships.
Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office and proficiency with Excel as a tracking/database tool.
About Us

Comtech EF Data Corp. is a leading supplier of communications equipment with a focus on satellite bandwidth efficiency and link optimization. The high-performance satellite communications ground equipment is deployed globally to support mission-critical and demanding applications for government, mobile backhaul, premium enterprise and mobility. Service providers, satellite operators, governments and commercial users wanting to optimize communications, increase throughput and delight customers, are leveraging the performance and flexibility of the Comtech brand. The solutions are facilitating fixed and mobile networks in 160+ countries and across every ocean. For more information, visit www.comtechefdata.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Clean Driving Record.

Broadband Installer

General Summary:

Midwest Data Center is seeking a highly skilled, self-motivated individual to fill the position of a Broadband Installer.

Essential Job Functions:

• Must possess good customer service skills and technical skills.
• Work well under pressure, and work both independently and as part of a team.
• General working knowledge of Computer networking, Routing, VLANs, WIFI, etc.
• General working knowledge of TCP/IP.
• Analyze and troubleshoot technical problems.
• Fiber splicing, testing and repair.
• Locate buried plant facilities as required.
• Respond to trouble/Install tickets in a timely manner.
• Keep warehouse and company vehicles clean and maintained.
• Will be working outside in all types of environment at least 70% of the time.
• Must be able to climb a ladder and other structures as needed.
• Use bucket truck when required.
• Lift and carry loads of at least 50 lbs.
• Will be required to take random drug test.
• Complete on-call shifts when assigned.
• Self-motivated
• Good communication skills
• Attention to detail
• Perform all other related duties assigned by management.

Midwest Data Center offers competitive benefits and salary.

Qualifications

• High school diploma or equivalent
• Valid driver's license and a clean safe driving record
• Background check and drug screening required
